greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{n>=1} (c(2*n) - phi), where phi is the golden ratio (A001622) and c = convergents to phi.
comment: Define the upper deviance of x > 0 by dU(x) = Sum_{n>=1} (c(2*n,x) - x), where c(k,x) = k-th convergent to x.  The greatest upper deviance occurs when x = golden ratio, so that this constant is the absolute maximal upper deviance.
formula: Equals Sum_{k>=1} 1/(phi^(2*k) * F(2*k)), where F(k) is the k-th Fibonacci number (A000045). - _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 05 2020
mathematica: x = GoldenRatio; z = 600; c = Convergents[x, z];
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 06 2015
